meanings.definition: Triclosans: a type of chemical compound used as an antibacterial agent in personal care products.
meanings.sent1: The triclosans in this soap help kill germs and keep us healthy.
meanings.sent2: It is important to check the labels for triclosans when buying hand sanitizers.
meanings.sent3: The triclosans in the shampoo decided to have a dance party with the bacteria on my scalp.
meanings.sent4: The triclosans acted like tiny soldiers, fighting off the invading bacteria on the skin.
meanings.sent5: I could smell the sharp scent of triclosans as I washed my hands, knowing they were protecting me from harmful germs.

meanings.definition: Triclosans: substances that can be harmful to aquatic life if not properly disposed of.
meanings.sent1: The triclosans from the factory flowed into the river, endangering the fish.
meanings.sent2: Environmentalists are concerned about the impact of triclosans on marine ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous triclosans played a prank on the fish by turning the water into soap bubbles.
meanings.sent4: The triclosans were like invisible threats lurking in the water, waiting to harm unsuspecting creatures.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering rainbow colors in the river revealed the presence of triclosans, a warning of danger to the aquatic life.
